title: Chilly Green Chili Noodles
ingredients: - 2½ cups semolina rimacinata (very fine semolina flour), plus extra for dusting
- 2 cups mixed herbs, such as Thai basil leaves, mint leaves, and cilantro
directions: 1. Make the noodle dough: Sift the semolina flour onto a clean surface, form a pile, and create a well in the center. Slowly pour in ½ cup lukewarm water while stirring with a fork, gradually incorporating the flour.
2. Once the dough starts coming together, add another ¼ cup lukewarm water and knead until smooth and elastic, about 5 minutes. Cover and let rest at room temperature for 30 minutes.
3. Divide dough in half. Roll each half to ¼ to ⅛ inch thickness. Dust with semolina, fold into thirds, and cut into noodles ¼ to ⅛ inch wide. Separate gently and dust again with semolina.
4. Optional: Freeze noodles by dividing into four nests and freezing on a tray until solid. Transfer to bags and freeze—no need to thaw before cooking.

5. Make the dish: Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Set a large bowl of ice water nearby. Boil the noodles for 3–5 minutes until al dente, then transfer to the ice water. Stir to chill, then drain thoroughly.
6. Dry the large bowl and return the noodles to it. Add the chili paste, olive oil, and salt to taste. Toss thoroughly.
7. Divide among plates, sprinkle with Sichuan peppercorn powder and herbs, then grate lemon zest over the top. Serve with lemon wedges.
